data.title: Came Back
data.text:
I had to come back to the Taqueria El Burrito. I was driving to Sac and made the effort to get here. It had been a couple of years ago.
Still the best mexican food I have found in Davis. Fresh and flavorful friendly staff, quick service reasonable prices. Lunch special or happy hour are good deals. Awesome salsa bar, with free chips if meal  is purchased. Gotta have that frosty adult beverage with the spicy meal. 
I will be back in the future.

data.title: Ok Best Mexican restaurant in Davis...
data.text: Finally a fantastic, authentic and pleasant Mexican restaurant in downtown Davis.  I can't  say enough about this place, so here it goes. First off; how do you tell a Mexican restaurant is good? When Mexicans eat there. With that said, their pastor meat was full of flavor and crispy. They have Negro Modelo on tap! Great salsa and condiment bar. Taco salad looked awesome. I'll keep coming back.  Well worth it.

data.title: good food for a really good price
data.text: Open seating with ordering at counter - they bring your food to your table - they have a self serve chips and salsa bar which I really like.  Food is very good and you get a great value for the price.

data.title: What kids think
data.text: I got the kids' chicken taco. I thought it would have the lettuce and cheese on the plate but it did not. I thought the chicken was good but wanted the crispy taco instead of soft. I think the grownup chicken taco would have been better for me. I am 7 years old and was traveling with my mom, grandma, and 6 year old brother.

data.title: My new favorite Mexican food in Davis
data.text: Have been here several times for lunch with friends and family and everything has been excellent.  Love the grilled chicken burrito.  They also have a huge salsa bar!

data.title: Well...at least it was cheap.
data.text: Driving through Davis on our way to Napa and we decided to grab a quick dinner. We were in the mood for Mexican and, since the reviews weren't terrible (and the other one was closed on Sunday) we thought we'd try this. Bad call. I wanted something lighter so opted for the taco salad "without rice."  I should have just ordered a chimichanga. The salad not only had rice on it, it was drowning in a heavy, thick sour cream looking sauce, over processed guacamole, and cheese sauce and there was less than a half cup of lettuce in it. It was just loaded with fat and grease and didn't even resemble a salad. Really unappetizing and a total waste of time, money, and calories. I'm sure there are better places in Davis. A pity we couldn't find one.

data.title: OMG it's good
data.text: If you crave really fine Mexican food, come here.  Service is order at the bar, cooking is done to order, and while you wait, you scope out the various and many salsas for your meal.  We have eaten here for years and the quality remains superb.  It is one of those places where after you eat, you think, you know, maybe just one taco or something more, no?  Bottom line:  yes yes omg yes!

data.title: Excellent food
data.text: We used to go to the Guad. but this place is soooo much better.    A little more money but well worth it and the location is awesome as well.    I've had all the various meats/burritos and they are all excellent.

data.title: Best Taqueria in Davis!!!
data.text: Our favorite Davis taqueria used to be Taqueria Guadalajara... which is still good, BUT Taqueria El Burrito far surpasses it!  The name is silly, and makes the place sound subpar, or like a crappy chain, but this place is the real deal.  They have the best carnitas I've ever had in my life and their plates are LOADED.  We have tried many dishes here and the only thing that I've had that I didn't like was a taco with shredded chicken.  The chicken is extremely bland - like boiled chicken with absolutely no salt/seasoning at all - so I don't recommend it, but everything else has been excellent.  They even have margaritas for about $5.  They always have several specials at great prices.  Service is excellent and if you want to watch futbal, they always have 4 screens of it showing.  They have really, really, really good homemade horchata and a couple of aguas frescas, plus fresh squeezed orange juice, and they also serve breakfast all day.
